titles.title: A resolution expressing support for the designation of November 2022 as "National Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Awareness Month".
A resolution expressing support for the designation of November 2022 as "National Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Awareness Month".

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary: This resolution supports the designation of November 2022 as National Alpha-1 Antitrypsin Deficiency Awareness Month. Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency is a genetic disease that increases the risk of harm to the lungs, liver, skin, and blood vessels.
